nearby_text.text: In the pictures that follow, you can see the program's DAC output pin while a function generator drives a 0-3.3V sine wave into   the ADC input pin, sweeping from 950-1050KHz over 12ms:
x               res     1   y               res     1   z               res     1   xdiff           res     1   ydiff           res     1

potential_captions: In the pictures that follow, you can see the program's DAC output pin while a function generator drives a 0-3.3V sine wave into   the ADC input pin, sweeping from 950-1050KHz over 12ms:

nearby_text.text: You can see that SINC2 mode has a higher Q than SINC1 mode. Due to rapid (X,Y) accumulator growth, SINC2 may require   the sine/cosine table to be reduced in amplitude to avoid (X,Y) accumulator overflow. This was done in the example program   above, where it was reduced from ±127 for SINC1 to ±10 for SINC2.
